text: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem and said,
&#34Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders? For they do not wash their hands before they eat.&#34
He answered them, &#34And why do you break the commandment of God for the sake of your tradition?
For God said, &#39Honor your father and your mother,&#39 and, &#39Whoever speaks evil of father or mother must surely die.&#39
But you say that whoever tells father or mother, &#39Whatever support you might have had from me is given to God,&#39 then that person need not honor the father.
So, for the sake of your tradition, you make void the word of God.
You hypocrites! Isaiah prophesied rightly about you when he said:
&#39This people honors me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me;
in vain do they worship me, teaching human precepts as doctrines.&#39&#34
Then he called the crowd to him and said to them, &#34Listen and understand:
it is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but it is what comes out of the mouth that defiles.&#34
Then the disciples approached and said to him, &#34Do you know that the Pharisees took offense when they heard what you said?&#34
He answered, &#34Every plant that my heavenly Father has not planted will be uprooted.
Let them alone; they are blind guides of the blind. And if one blind person guides another, both will fall into a pit.&#34
But Peter said to him, &#34Explain this parable to us.&#34
Then he said, &#34Are you also still without understanding?
Do you not see that whatever goes into the mouth enters the stomach, and goes out into the sewer?
But what comes out of the mouth proceeds from the heart, and this is what defiles.
For out of the heart come evil intentions, murder, adultery, fornication, theft, false witness, slander.
These are what defile a person, but to eat with unwashed hands does not defile.&#34
Jesus left that place and went away to the district of Tyre and Sidon.
Just then a Canaanite woman from that region came out and started shouting, &#34Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David; my daughter is tormented by a demon.&#34
But he did not answer her at all. And his disciples came and urged him, saying, &#34Send her away, for she keeps shouting after us.&#34
He answered, &#34I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.&#34
But she came and knelt before him, saying, &#34Lord, help me.&#34
He answered, &#34It is not fair to take the children&#39s food and throw it to the dogs.&#34
She said, &#34Yes, Lord, yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters&#39 table.&#34
Then Jesus answered her, &#34Woman, great is your faith! Let it be done for you as you wish.&#34 And her daughter was healed instantly.
After Jesus had left that place, he passed along the Sea of Galilee, and he went up the mountain, where he sat down.
Great crowds came to him, bringing with them the lame, the maimed, the blind, the mute, and many others. They put them at his feet, and he cured them,
so that the crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the maimed whole, the lame walking, and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel.

Then Jesus called his disciples to him and said, &#34I have compassion for the crowd, because they have been with me now for three days and have nothing to eat; and I do not want to send them away hungry, for they might faint on the way.&#34
The disciples said to him, &#34Where are we to get enough bread in the desert to feed so great a crowd?&#34
Jesus asked them, &#34How many loaves have you?&#34 They said, &#34Seven, and a few small fish.&#34
Then ordering the crowd to sit down on the ground,
he took the seven loaves and the fish; and after giving thanks he broke them and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the crowds.
And all of them ate and were filled; and they took up the broken pieces left over, seven baskets full.
Those who had eaten were four thousand men, besides women and children.
After sending away the crowds, he got into the boat and went to the region of Magadan.
